description: Personal brand and agency website for Asor Ahura, featuring a dual-brand system (Personal Authority + Flowmorph Agency).

userStories.title: Project Setup & Infrastructure
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the base project configured with the correct tech stack and design tokens.
acceptanceCriteria: Initialize Next.js (App Router) project
Configure TypeScript and ESLint
Setup MDX for content management
Configure global typography: Serif (Primary/Headlines) and Sans-serif (Secondary/UI)
Define color palette: Light theme, high contrast, studio/lab aesthetic
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Global Navigation & Layout
userStories.description: As a visitor, I need to navigate between the four core pillars of the site.
acceptanceCriteria: Implement responsive navigation bar
Links: Home (/), Work (/work), Flowmorph (/flowmorph), Engage (/engage)
Minimalist design compatible with the 'Lab' aesthetic
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
userStories.notes: Navigation must support the dual-brand logic (Asor Ahura vs Flowmorph)

userStories.title: Home Page - Authority Hub
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to immediately understand Asor Ahura's positioning and authority.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero Section: 'Transforming Work into Flow' with primary and secondary CTAs
Problem Section: Operational friction, manual bottlenecks
Philosophy Section: Automation is liberation, Systems > Tools
What I Do Section: AI automation architecture, compliance-first automation
Proof Signals: Placeholders for diagrams/logos
Bridge Section: Link to Flowmorph for deep transformation
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Primary conversion page for personal authority.

userStories.title: Flowmorph Page - Agency Engine
userStories.description: As a business owner, I want to understand the agency's capabilities for high-volume automation.
acceptanceCriteria: Distinct Hero: 'Flowmorph - Transforming Work into Flow'
Philosophy Section: Automation = Liberation, Humans create/Machines execute
Services Section: Intelligent Document Processing, AI Agent Systems
Methodology: Diagnosis -> Design -> Deployment -> Optimization
Audience Filter: 'Who Flowmorph Is For' (High-volume, scaling startups)
Engagement CTA: High-value/limited engagement focus
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Must feel like a serious standalone company/studio.

userStories.title: Work / Systems Page
userStories.description: As a prospect, I want to see proof of capability through systems and architectures.
acceptanceCriteria: Layout for Thematic System Areas (Document Intelligence, Process Orchestration)
Components for System Diagrams and Architecture Sketches
Structure for abstracted case studies (Context -> Bottleneck -> Approach -> Outcome)
Disclaimer component for anonymized work
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Not a chronological portfolio. Thematic and system-focused.

userStories.title: Engage Page
userStories.description: As a qualified lead, I want a frictionless way to initiate a serious inquiry.
acceptanceCriteria: Filtering Content: 'Who I Work With' & Engagement Thresholds
Custom Contact Form using Server Actions
Fields for specific inquiry qualification
Narrative elements about background (Corporate + Software)
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Goal is to filter for serious inquiries only.

userStories.title: Dynamic Content Integration
userStories.description: As the site owner, I want the site to feel alive with recent activity.
acceptanceCriteria: Components/Placeholders for recent LinkedIn posts
Components/Placeholders for latest YouTube videos
Structure to easily update external SaaS links/demos
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: No traditional blog. Content updates signal activity.
